alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:10PM EST until February 19 at 4:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN and Ripley. In Southwest Ohio, Butler, Clermont, Clinton, Hamilton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM EST, radar indicated heavy rain moving into the area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible into this evening. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin and Springdale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
